pli-tv-kd8:15.13.4_0: When I recall that, I will feel glad. The gladness will give rise to joy, and the mental joy will make my body tranquil. When my body is tranquil, I will feel bliss. And when I feel bliss, my mind will be stilled.

pli-tv-kd8:15.8.1_0: Also, not knowing the streets or where to go for almsfood, newly arrived monks will get exhausted while walking for alms.
pli-tv-kd8:15.8.2_0: After eating a meal for newly arrived monks from me, they will get to know the streets and where to go for almsfood, and they won’t get exhausted while walking for alms.
pli-tv-kd8:15.8.3_0: This is the reason I wish to give meals to the newly arrived monks for as long as I live.
pli-tv-kd8:15.8.4_0: Also, in trying to get a meal, departing monks may bother the Teacher, or they may arrive late at their destination. Or, if they go without eating, they will be weak while traveling.
pli-tv-kd8:15.8.5_0: After eating a meal for departing monks from me, they won’t bother the Teacher, they will arrive at their destination at an appropriate time, and they won’t be weak while traveling.
pli-tv-kd8:15.8.6_0: This is the reason I wish to give meals to the departing monks for as long as I live.
pli-tv-kd8:15.9.1_0: Also, if sick monks don’t get suitable food, their illness may get worse or they may die.
pli-tv-kd8:15.9.2_0: But when they have eaten a meal for the sick from me, their illness won’t get worse and they won’t die.
pli-tv-kd8:15.9.3_0: This is the reason I wish to give meals to the sick monks for as long as I live.
pli-tv-kd8:15.9.4_0: Also, if the monks who nurse the sick have to get their own meals, they will only be able to bring back meals for the sick after midday, and the sick won’t be able to eat.
pli-tv-kd8:15.9.5_0: But when they have eaten a meal for those nursing the sick from me, they will be able to bring back meals for the sick in good time, and the sick will be able to eat.
pli-tv-kd8:15.9.6_0: This is the reason I wish to give meals to those monks who nurse the sick for as long as I live.

pli-tv-kd8:16.2.15_0: And, Ānanda, it’s impossible for a perfected one to emit semen.’
pli-tv-kd8:16.2.1_0: and the Buddha said, “That’s how it is, Ānanda.

pli-tv-kd8:16.3.3_0: These are the five drawbacks of falling asleep unmindful and unaware.

pli-tv-kd8:25.3.13_0: “You should not spend the rainy-season residence in one place and accept a share of the robe-cloth from somewhere else.

pli-tv-kd8:25.3.3_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,

pli-tv-kd8:26.1.10_0: “Because I don’t do anything for them.”

pli-tv-kd8:26.5.1_0: When a sick person has five qualities, they are hard to nurse:
pli-tv-kd8:26.5.2_0: they do what is detrimental for curing the sickness; they do not know the right amount in what is beneficial; they do not take their medicine; they do not accurately report the state of their illness—whether it’s getting worse, getting better, or remaining the same—to the one who is nursing and trying to help them; they are unable to bear up with bodily feelings that are painful, severe, sharp, and life-threatening.
pli-tv-kd8:26.5.3_0: A patient with these five qualities is hard to nurse.
pli-tv-kd8:26.6.1_0: When a sick person has five qualities, they are easy to nurse:
pli-tv-kd8:26.6.2_0: they do what is beneficial for curing the sickness; they know the right amount in what is beneficial; they take their medicine; they accurately report the state of their illness—whether it’s getting worse, getting better, or remaining the same—to the one who is nursing and trying to help them; they are able to bear up with bodily feelings that are painful, severe, sharp, and life-threatening.
pli-tv-kd8:26.6.3_0: A patient with these five qualities is easy to care for.
pli-tv-kd8:26.7.1_0: When an attendant has five qualities, they are unsuited to nurse the sick:
pli-tv-kd8:26.7.2_0: they are incapable of preparing medicine; not knowing what is beneficial and what is harmful, they bring what is harmful and remove what is beneficial; they nurse the sick for the sake of worldly gain, not with a mind of kindness; they are disgusted at having to clean up feces, urine, spit, or vomit; they are incapable of instructing, inspiring, and gladdening the sick person with a Dhamma talk from time to time.
pli-tv-kd8:26.7.3_0: A carer with these five factors is not competent to care for a patient.
pli-tv-kd8:26.8.1_0: When an attendant has five qualities, they are suited to nurse the sick:
pli-tv-kd8:26.8.2_0: they are capable of preparing medicine; knowing what is beneficial and what is harmful, they remove what is harmful and bring what is beneficial; they nurse the sick with a mind of kindness, not for the sake of worldly gain; they are not disgusted at having to clean up feces, urine, spit, or vomit; they are capable of instructing, inspiring, and gladdening the sick person with a Dhamma talk from time to time.
pli-tv-kd8:26.8.3_0: A carer with these five factors is competent to care for a patient.”

pli-tv-kd8:8.2.1_0: Soon afterwards the monks from the group of six dismissed the storeman.
pli-tv-kd8:8.2.2_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
pli-tv-kd8:8.2.4_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-kd8:9.1.10_0: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
pli-tv-kd8:9.1.11_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
pli-tv-kd8:9.1.12_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, it should appoint monk so-and-so as the distributor of robe-cloth.
pli-tv-kd8:9.1.14_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
pli-tv-kd8:9.1.15_0: The Sangha appoints monk so-and-so as the distributor of robe-cloth.
pli-tv-kd8:9.1.16_0: Any monk who approves of appointing monk so-and-so as the distributor of robe-cloth should remain silent.
pli-tv-kd8:9.1.17_0: Any monk who doesn’t approves should speak up.
pli-tv-kd8:9.1.18_0: The Sangha has appointed monk so-and-so as the distributor of robe-cloth.
pli-tv-kd8:9.1.19_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
pli-tv-kd8:9.1.1_0: At one time there was much robe-cloth in the Sangha’s storeroom.
pli-tv-kd8:9.1.2_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
pli-tv-kd8:9.1.3_0: “You should share it out in the presence of the Sangha.”
pli-tv-kd8:9.1.4_0: Soon afterwards there was a racket as the Sangha was sharing out the robe-cloth.
pli-tv-kd8:9.1.5_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
pli-tv-kd8:9.1.6_0: “You should appoint a monk who has five qualities as the distributor of robe-cloth:
pli-tv-kd8:9.1.7_0: he is not swayed by desire, ill will, confusion, or fear, and he knows what is and is not stored.
pli-tv-kd8:9.1.8_0: And this is how it should be designated.
pli-tv-kd8:9.1.9_0: First a monk should be asked
pli-tv-kd8:9.2.1_0: And the distributors of robe-cloth thought,
pli-tv-kd8:9.2.3_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
pli-tv-kd8:9.2.4_0: “You should first sort the cloth, then estimate its value, followed by making portions of equal value, counting the monks, gathering the monks into groups, and finally fixing the shares of robe-cloth.”
pli-tv-kd8:9.2.5_0: And the distributors of robe-cloth thought,
pli-tv-kd8:9.2.6_0: “What share of the robe-cloth should we give to the novices?”
pli-tv-kd8:9.2.7_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
pli-tv-kd8:9.2.8_0: “I allow you to give half a share to the novices.”
pli-tv-kd8:9.3.1_0: On one occasion a monk wanted to take his own share and depart.
pli-tv-kd8:9.3.2_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
pli-tv-kd8:9.3.3_0: “You should give a share to one who is departing.”
pli-tv-kd8:9.3.4_0: On another occasion a monk wanted to take an extra share and depart.
pli-tv-kd8:9.3.5_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
pli-tv-kd8:9.3.6_0: “I allow you to give an extra share to anyone who gives something in return.”
pli-tv-kd8:9.4.1_0: And the distributors of robe-cloth thought,
pli-tv-kd8:9.4.2_0: “How should we give out the shares of robe-cloth? According to the order in which the monks have arrived or according to seniority?”
pli-tv-kd8:9.4.3_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
pli-tv-kd8:9.4.4_0: “You should share out the remainder and then give it out by drawing lots.”
